verses.esv: 29 Let no corrupting talk come out of your mouths, but only such as is good for building up, as fits the occasion, that it may give grace to those who hear.
verses.kjv: 29 Let no corrupt communication proceed out of your mouth, but that which is good to the use of edifying, that it may minister grace unto the hearers.
verses.niv: 29 Do not let any unwholesome talk come out of your mouths, but only what is helpful for building others up according to their needs, that it may benefit those who listen.

verses.esv: 19 Know this, my beloved brothers: let every person be quick to hear, slow to speak, slow to anger;
verses.kjv: 19 Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath:
verses.niv: 19 My dear brothers, take note of this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry,

verses.esv:
15:1   A soft answer turns away wrath,
    but a harsh word stirs up anger.
verses.kjv: 1 A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.
verses.niv: 1 A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.

verses.esv:
3   Set a guard, O LORD, over my mouth;
    keep watch over the door of my lips!
verses.kjv: 3 Set a watch, O LORD, before my mouth; keep the door of my lips.
verses.niv: 3 Set a guard over my mouth, O LORD; keep watch over the door of my lips.

verses.esv: 6 Let your speech always be gracious, seasoned with salt, so that you may know how you ought to answer each person.
verses.kjv: 6 Let your speech be alway with grace, seasoned with salt, that ye may know how ye ought to answer every man.
verses.niv: 6 Let your conversation be always full of grace, seasoned with salt, so that you may know how to answer everyone.

verses.esv:
18   There is one whose rash words are like sword thrusts,
    but the tongue of the wise brings healing.
verses.kjv: 18 There is that speaketh like the piercings of a sword: but the tongue of the wise is health.
verses.niv: 18 Reckless words pierce like a sword, but the tongue of the wise brings healing.

verses.esv:
2   The tongue of the wise commends knowledge,
    but the mouths of fools pour out folly.
verses.kjv: 2 The tongue of the wise useth knowledge aright: but the mouth of fools poureth out foolishness.
verses.niv: 2 The tongue of the wise commends knowledge, but the mouth of the fool gushes folly.

verses.esv:
14   Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart
    be acceptable in your sight,
    O LORD, my rock and my redeemer.
verses.kjv: 14 Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O LORD, my strength, and my redeemer.
verses.niv: 14 May the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be pleasing in your sight, O Lord, my Rock and my Redeemer.

verses.esv:
2   A fool takes no pleasure in understanding,
    but only in expressing his opinion.
verses.kjv: 2 A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that his heart may discover itself.
verses.niv: 2 A fool finds no pleasure in understanding but delights in airing his own opinions.

verses.esv: 16 But avoid irreverent babble, for it will lead people into more and more ungodliness,
verses.kjv: 16 But shun profane and vain babblings: for they will increase unto more ungodliness.
verses.niv: 16 Avoid godless chatter, because those who indulge in it will become more and more ungodly.

verses.esv:
13   If one gives an answer before he hears,
    it is his folly and shame.
verses.kjv: 13 He that answereth a matter before he heareth it, it is folly and shame unto him.
verses.niv: 13 He who answers before listening- that is his folly and his shame.

verses.esv:
11   A word fitly spoken
    is like apples of gold in a setting of silver.
verses.kjv: 11 A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.
verses.niv: 11 A word aptly spoken is like apples of gold in settings of silver.

verses.esv: 12 For the word of God is living and active, sharper than any two-edged sword, piercing to the division of soul and of spirit, of joints and of marrow, and discerning the thoughts and intentions of the heart.
verses.kjv: 12 For the word of God is quick, and powerful, and sharper than any twoedged sword, piercing even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit, and of the joints and marrow, and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.
verses.niv: 12 For the word of God is living and active. Sharper than any double--edged sword, it penetrates even to dividing soul and spirit, joints and marrow; it judges the thoughts and attitudes of the heart.

verses.esv:
19   When words are many, transgression is not lacking,
    but whoever restrains his lips is prudent.
verses.kjv: 19 In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips is wise.
verses.niv: 19 When words are many, sin is not absent, but he who holds his tongue is wise.

verses.esv:
23   The heart of the wise makes his speech judicious
    and adds persuasiveness to his lips.
verses.kjv: 23 The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth, and addeth learning to his lips.
verses.niv: 23 A wise man's heart guides his mouth, and his lips promote instruction.

verses.esv:
9 Then the LORD put out his hand and touched my mouth. And the LORD said to me,

  “Behold, I have put my words in your mouth.
verses.kjv: 9 Then the LORD put forth his hand, and touched my mouth. And the LORD said unto me, Behold, I have put my words in thy mouth.
verses.niv: 9 Then the LORD reached out his hand and touched my mouth and said to me, "Now, I have put my words in your mouth.

verses.esv:
21   Death and life are in the power of the tongue,
    and those who love it will eat its fruits.
verses.kjv: 21 Death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.
verses.niv: 21 The tongue has the power of life and death, and those who love it will eat its fruit.

verses.esv:
17   A wicked messenger falls into trouble,
    but a faithful envoy brings healing.
verses.kjv: 17 A wicked messenger falleth into mischief: but a faithful ambassador is health.
verses.niv: 17 A wicked messenger falls into trouble, but a trustworthy envoy brings healing.

verses.esv: 15 Rather, speaking the truth in love, we are to grow up in every way into him who is the head, into Christ,
verses.kjv: 15 But speaking the truth in love, may grow up into him in all things, which is the head, even Christ:
verses.niv: 15 Instead, speaking the truth in love, we will in all things grow up into him who is the Head, that is, Christ.

verses.esv: 8 But now you must put them all away: anger, wrath, malice, slander, and obscene talk from your mouth.
verses.kjv: 8 But now ye also put off all these; anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy communication out of your mouth.
verses.niv: 8 But now you must rid yourselves of all such things as these: anger, rage, malice, slander, and filthy language from your lips.

verses.esv: 16 All Scripture is breathed out by God and profitable for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for training in righteousness,
verses.kjv: 16 All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness:
verses.niv: 16 All Scripture is God-breathed and is useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting and training in righteousness,

verses.esv: 18 But what comes out of the mouth proceeds from the heart, and this defiles a person. 19 For out of the heart come evil thoughts, murder, adultery, sexual immorality, theft, false witness, slander.
verses.kjv: 18 But those things which proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart; and they defile the man. 19 For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, blasphemies:
verses.niv: 18 But the things that come out of the mouth come from the heart, and these make a man 'unclean.' 19 For out of the heart come evil thoughts, murder, adultery, sexual immorality, theft, false testimony, slander.

verses.esv: 14 The natural person does not accept the things of the Spirit of God, for they are folly to him, and he is not able to understand them because they are spiritually discerned.
verses.kjv: 14 But the natural man receiveth not the things of the Spirit of God: for they are foolishness unto him: neither can he know them, because they are spiritually discerned.
verses.niv: 14 The man without the Spirit does not accept the things that come from the Spirit of God, for they are foolishness to him, and he cannot understand them, because they are spiritually discerned.

verses.esv:
20   From the fruit of a man’s mouth his stomach is satisfied;
    he is satisfied by the yield of his lips.
21   Death and life are in the power of the tongue,
    and those who love it will eat its fruits.
verses.kjv: 20 A man’s belly shall be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth; and with the increase of his lips shall he be filled. 21 Death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.
verses.niv: 20 From the fruit of his mouth a man's stomach is filled; with the harvest from his lips he is satisfied. 21 The tongue has the power of life and death, and those who love it will eat its fruit.

verses.esv:
11   A fool gives full vent to his spirit,
    but a wise man quietly holds it back.
verses.kjv: 11 A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterwards.
verses.niv: 11 A fool gives full vent to his anger, but a wise man keeps himself under control.
